result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyson A. Schulz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: --pay costs, fees, and the DNA Surcharge as calculated by the clerk;  this amount is to be entered as a civil judgment.

--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment or home-care; to commence forthwith

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

The Court orders DNA sample provision.

*** Per 8/8/17 Order: Court orders that the Judgment of Conviction be amended to state that the defendant is awarded one day of pre-sentence jail credit.***

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] cases #16CM161, #16CM352, #16CF143, #16CF282, #16CF397, #17CF81 called at 1:37pm. 
Defendant Tyson A. Schulz in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Case #16CF282-Count #1 and Case #17CF81, and Case #16CM161, and Case #16CF397-Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.
Domestic Abuse Finding is made as to Case #16CF397-Count #1.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #16CF282-Count #2, and Case #16CF397-remaining counts [Counts #3, #4, #5], and Case #16CF143, and Case #16CM352.  Further the Court reads-in an uncharged referral for Bailjumping on 12/13/16 (DA Case #17JE462) and an uncharged referral for Bailjumping on 1/28/17 (DA Case #17JE331) and thereafter bars further prosecution of these referrals. 
During the Sentencing portion of the hearing, a statement in support of Mr. Schulz is made by his grandfather Mr. Sproul. 

In Case #16CM161 the Court sentences Mr. Schulz to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment or home-care; to commence forthwith
--the Court grants Attorney Dahnert's request to submit a written stipulation on sentence credit 
--pay costs, fees, and the DNA Surcharge as calculated by the clerk;  this amount is to be entered as a civil judgment.  
The Court orders DNA sample provision.


In Case #16CF397-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Schulz to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment, or home-care; to commence forthwith, concurrent with Case #16CM161
--the Court grants Attorney Dahnert's request to submit a written stipulation on sentence credit 
--pay costs, fees, and surcharges, including the DNA Surcharge and the Domestic Abuse Surcharge, as calculated by the clerk;  this amount is to be entered as a civil judgment.  
The Court orders DNA sample provision.

---------------------------------------
On Case #16CF397-Count #2, Case #16CF282, Case #17CF81 each the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Schulz on Probation for three years concurrent, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment, treatment and follow through
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as may be required by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--to complete Certified Batterers Intervention programming
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by the treating physician
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random alcohol and drug screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as supervised by the Agent
--DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge as calculated by the clerk 

As to days credit on these cases, the Court grants Attorney Dahnert's request to submit a written stipulation on sentence credit 
recess 1:54pm.
Order modifying bond - removing the requirement that the defendant not leave his house without being escorted by his parents or grandparents.
State's
Order to Modify Bond
Stipulation to Modify Bond
Status conference on July 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

[NL] cases 16CF143, 16CF282, 16CF397, 16CM161, 16CM352, & 17CF81 called at 10:45 am
Defendant Tyson A. Schulz in court with attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

IN 17CF81 ONLY--
Mr.Schulz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing ; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Attorney Dahnert informs the Court the parties are at an impasse and the cases should be scheduled for trials.
The Court and counsel discuss that the global plea agreement involves the defense wanting to be free to argue the jail term recommendation. 

The Court indicates it is scheduling the oldest felony case for trial.
Recess: 
11:08

NEXT:   1 FSCC in case 17CF81  & Status in all other cases 7/24/17 @ 1:30 am  (2) Jury Trail in case 17CF81 Only 7/27/17 & 7/28/17
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2017 at 10:30 am.

[MK] cases #16CF143, #16CF282, #16CF397, #16CM161, #16CM352, and #17CF81 called at 4:24pm
Defendant Tyson A. Schulz in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the clerk's inquiries regarding the filing of an Amended Complaint in case #17CF81, the Court clarifies with counsel that the subject amendment involves clerical-type corrections, and thereafter the Court indicates that it does not intend to process the Amended Complaint.  
Attorney Dahnert indicates that Mr. Schulz intends to waive Preliminary Hearing rights in case #17CF81.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
Attorney Dahnert requests modification of Bond conditions to allow Mr. Schulz to walk to an area near his grandparents' home to fish.
The Court indicates that it will give consideration to such a motion, however it needs to be filed and noticed formally.  
recess 4:35pm
[Post Hearing/Off Record but in the presence of the parties the Court indicates to Mr. Shulz and his Grandfather that Mr. Schulz would be in compliance with the Bond conditions if he fishes on the river within the sight-line of his Grandfather who would need to be outside of the house during that time.]  

NEXT:   Waiver of Prelim & Arraignment in Case #17CF81 and Plea/Sentencing on all cases on 6/16/17 at 10:30am.
Per Judicial Rotation and Case Assignment Plan effective 4/1/17
Scheduling Order
Status conference on May 2, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

[MK] cases #16CF143, #16CF397, #16CM161, #16CM352, #16CF282 called briefly at 9:03am, and then at 9:16am.
Defendant Tyson A. Schulz in court with Attorney Sylvie H Dahnert.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Dahnert files a Motion to Modify Bond.  After review of the files, the Court concludes that the bond-modification sought is soley a condition of Bond in Case #16CF143.
Arguments given on Bond. 
The Court removes from the Bond in Case #16CF143 and any other case in which that Bond requirement may be imposed the condition that Tyson Schulz be escorted to school and work by his grandparents.  The Court requires Mr. Schulz to attend work as scheduled.  
Attorney Dahnert proposes that the cases be scheduled for change-of-plea and sentencing.  
recess 9:20am. 
[Post-hearing the clerk clarifies with the Court that in Case #16CF143 the bond conditions should include that Mr. Schulz is to be at his grandparents home except when at school or work;  he may otherwise leave the residence if he is escorted by his grandparents.]

NEXT:  Attorney Dahnert is to contact the JA to arrange for a plea/sentencing hearing on all cases in January [JA- the felony cases are at Prelim stage, so Waivers of Prelim should be scheduled also]
IT IS ORDERED that the continuance is granted and the new time appointed is 12-12-16 at 8:30am

Cases 16CF281,16CF282, 16CF143, and 16CM352 called together at 2:08pm [MA]
Co- Defendant Brice M. Wills in court, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann
Co-Defendant Tyson A. Schulz in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert

As to 16CF281, Brice Wills:
The Court verifies date of birth and address 
 Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1000   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

As to Case 16CF282, Tyson Schulz:

The Court calls case 16CM161 at 2:19pm

The Court considers the warrants in cases 16CM352, 16CM161,and 16CF143 to be executed and are to removed from any database in which they are entered

As to Case 16CF143:
Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no presence at the Mexican Grocery Store in Fort Atkinson
--no contact with Devon Montiel or Trista Stuzinski
--Mr. Schulz is to always be at grandparents home, unless escorted by grandparents or parents or when going to and from school.
--Mr. Schulz is not to skip one class at school, not to be late to school, not to be absent from school without a doctors excuse
--booking if has not previously been completed

As to Case 16CM352:
The Court requires a $1500 Signature Bond, with condition: booking at JESO today.

As to Case 16CM161:
The Court requires a $1500 Signature Bond, with same non monetary conditions as previously set.

As to Case 16CF143: Parties waive speedy preliminary hearing rights

Atty. Dahnert requests that all cases track together; no objection from the Court.

Mr. Schulz updates his address to 816 Dempster St. in Fort Atkinson, 53538
